snippet: Georges Hoentschel, a once-famous French interior decorator, is among the forgotten. With luck, his obscurity may end with a new show at the Bard Graduate Center.
abstract: Roberta Smith reviews Salvaging the Past: Georges Hoentschel and French Decorative Arts From the Metropolitan Museum of Art at Bard Graduate Center.
lead_paragraph: Georges Hoentschel, a once-famous French interior decorator, is among the forgotten. With luck, his obscurity may end with a new show at the Bard Graduate Center.

headline.seo: ‘Salvaging the Past,’ on Hoentschel, at Bard Graduate Center
headline.main: You Might Call Him the Decorator of the Met
headline.print_headline: You Might Call Him the Decorator of the Met
